REST API repository Contacts¶

async app.repository.contacts.create(body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The create function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object that was created

async app.repository.contacts.find_contact_by_email(contact_email: str, db: Session)¶

The find_contact_by_email function takes in a contact_email and db as parameters. It then queries the database for all contacts with that email address, and returns them.

Parameters:

  • contact_email – str: Specify the email of the contact that we want to find

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

async app.repository.contacts.find_contact_by_firstname(contact_firstname: str, db: Session)¶

The find_contact_by_firstname function takes in a contact_firstname and db as parameters. It then queries the database for all contacts with that first name, and returns them.

Parameters:

  • contact_firstname – str: Pass in the first name of a contact to search for

  • db – Session: Pass in a database session object

Returns:

A list of contacts with the given first name

async app.repository.contacts.find_contact_by_lastname(contact_lastname: str, db: Session)¶

The find_contact_by_lastname function takes in a contact_lastname and db as parameters. It then queries the database for all contacts with that last name, and returns them.

Parameters:

  • contact_lastname – str: Pass in the last name of a contact

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

async app.repository.contacts.find_contacts_birthday(db: Session)¶

The find_contacts_birthday function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next week.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A list of contacts with a birthday in the next 7 days

async app.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_email function returns a contact object from the database based on the email address provided.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the contact to be returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact with the given email

async app.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact object from the database based on its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that is being requested

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The contact object associated with the given id

async app.repository.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts in the database

async app.repository.contacts.remove(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The remove function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be removed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was removed, or none if no such contact exists

async app.repository.contacts.update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The update function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact by id

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact data to update

  • db – Session: Create a connection to the database

Returns:

The updated contact

REST API repository Users¶

async app.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async app.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Ensure that the data passed in is of type UserModel

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async app.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email if it exists. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of parameter that will be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object if the email exists in the database

async app.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async app.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • refresh_token – Update the user’s refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

async app.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database. It takes an email, first_name, last_name and phone number as input parameters. The function returns the newly created contact object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A ContactModel object

async app.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database. The function takes in an integer as a parameter, which is the ID of the contact to be deleted.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to be deleted

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The deleted contact

async app.routes.contacts.find_contact_by_firstname(contact_firstname: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The find_contact_by_firstname function is used to find a contact by their first name. The function takes in the contact’s first name as an argument and returns the contact object if found.

Parameters:

  • contact_firstname – str: Get the firstname of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

async app.routes.contacts.find_contact_by_lastname(contact_lastname: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The find_contact_by_lastname function is used to find a contact by their last name. The function takes in the contact’s last name as an argument and returns the contact object if found.

Parameters:

  • contact_lastname – str: Find the contact by lastname

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

async app.routes.contacts.find_contacts_birthday(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The find_contacts_birthday function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays in the current month.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays

async app.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. If no such contact exists, it raises an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact_id of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

A contact object

async app.routes.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the token

Returns:

A list of contacts

async app.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database. The function takes an id and a body as input, and returns the updated contact. If no contact is found with that id, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Specify the data that will be sent in the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the id of the contact to be updated

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A ContactModel object, which is the same as what we use for creating contacts

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current_user object

async app.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

REST API routes Auth¶

async app.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirm the user’s email address using the provided token.

Parameters:

  • token – str - The token for email confirmation.

  • db – Session - The database session dependency.

Returns:

dict - A message indicating the result of the confirmation process.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the verification fails.

app.routes.auth.get_gravatar_url(email: str, size: int = 200) → str¶

Generate a Gravatar URL for the given email address.

Parameters:

  • email – str - The email address of the user.

  • size – int - The size of the Gravatar image. Default is 200.

Returns:

str - The Gravatar URL.

async app.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticate a user and return JWT tokens.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm - The form containing username and password.

  • db – Session - The database session dependency.

Returns:

TokenModel - The response model containing the access and refresh tokens.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email or password is invalid.

async app.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh the JWT tokens using the refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials - The security credentials containing the refresh token.

  • db – Session - The database session dependency.

Returns:

TokenModel - The response model containing the new access and refresh tokens.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid.

async app.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Request a confirmation email to be sent to the user.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail - The request body containing the email address.

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks - The background tasks for sending the email.

  • request – Request - The request object to get the base URL.

  • db – Session - The database session dependency.

Returns:

dict - A message indicating the email has been sent.

async app.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Register a new user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel - The user model containing user details.

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks - The background tasks for sending confirmation email.

  • request – Request - The request object to get the base URL.

  • db – Session - The database session dependency.

Returns:

UserResponse - The response model for the created user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user already exists.

REST API service Auth¶

class app.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded in the jwt token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Specify the time in seconds that the access token will be valid for

Returns:

A jwt token that is encoded with the user’s data, a timestamp for when it was created and an expiration date

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY, which is stored in the .env file. The algorithm used to encode the token is also stored in the .env file.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into a jwt

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email, a timestamp and an expiration date

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A jwt that contains the user’s id,

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that was received from the client

Returns:

The email address of the user

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, or raises an exception otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, then checking to make sure that it has a scope of ‘email_token’. It returns the email address from the payload’s subfield. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &quot;Invalid scope for token&quot;. If there is any other error in decoding or validating the JWT, we raise another HTTPException with status code 422 (Unprocessed)

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address associated with the token

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Specify the password that will be hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method a bound method, which means that it can be called on an instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Check if the password is hashed

Returns:

A boolean value

async app.services.mail.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username of the user to be registered

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the template

Returns:

A coroutine, which is an object that can be awaited
